main event: A round, extremely bright, white-yellow object was observed in NW Atlanta, Ga in 1955 for 45 seconds to 1 minute.
interesting points: The object was described as round and extremely bright, like a light bulb.
It was observed by one person and was detected on ground-radar.
The Air Force concluded that the object was a B-36 aircraft with a scanner searchlight operating from a blister on the side of the aircraft.
The sighting occurred in a partially cloudy sky with the moon visible at times, and there were numerous civilian aircraft in the area at the time.
A pilot flying in the same area and course as the object did not keep the object in sight, and the object was estimated to be flying at approximately the same altitude as the aircraft.
witnesses: one person observed the object, detected on ground-radar
